intro: Arnica ventorum, commonly known as the mountain arnica, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the genus Arnica in the family Asteraceae, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers that are typically arranged in a single head, surrounded by leaf-like bracts. Its leaves are basal, linear, and hairy, adapted to the harsh conditions of high altitudes. Arnica ventorum is often found in rocky soils and meadows, thriving in cool, moist environments.
